title: Town Square, West - 285
description: Here in the midst of the town stretches the cobblestoned main bazaar, its serpentine lanes abuzz with traders bartering, bickering, and hawking their wares.  The freewheeling vendors in the bazaar provide a lively alternative to the somewhat stodgier merchants whose shops border the square.  The gilded but peeling stone facade of the First Elanith Bank dominates this side of the square.

title: Wehnimer's, Winter St. - 295
description: A steady stream of shoppers and traders flows through this avenue.  On the west side of the road is the grocer's shop, where provisions, from the humblest sack of flour to the rarest varieties of Gnollish mushrooms, can be bought.

title: Wehnimer's, West Ring Rd. - 292
description: The lane to the east leads into the heart of town and the main square.  The back wall of the grocer's shop borders the road, its wide door surrounded by piles of rough gunny sacks and stacks of wooden crates, some empty, others still to be unpacked.

title: Wehnimer's, West Ring Rd. - 293
description: The road passes beneath the shadow of the palisade.  Before you sprawls a gaudily-painted structure, adorned with elaborate carvings depicting scenes of commerce in an almost reverential style.  This is the Merchant's Guild, where the business people of town, from wealthy traders to lowly street peddlers, meet to discuss matters of mutual concern.

title: Wehnimer's, West Ring Rd. - 294
description: This cobbled road circles the town, providing access to the bazaar and the fringes of the surrounding neighborhoods.  Several members of the militia, wearing leather armor and bearing short swords and daggers, eye the crowds and keep silent watch over the street, which bustles with well-heeled merchants, traders and shopkeepers.

title: Wehnimer's, North Ring Rd. - 225
description: The road turns gradually at this point as it forms the northwest corner of the city.  The main path curves along the north and west walls, and another leads south between the buildings.  The massive oak and modwir logs of the city palisade tower overhead.

title: Wehnimer's, North Ring Rd. - 224
description: The cobbled road girds the town along the inner side of the northern palisade.  Just to the north stand the twin sentinels of the gate's guardtowers.  Guardsmen come and go through the main gates, keeping a close eye on the people of all races who move to and fro.  Opposite the gates, you see the shop of Dakris the Furrier.

title: Wehnimer's, North Ring Rd. - 286
description: Guards and militiamen pass by, moving between the barracks and the guard towers at either end of the north road.  The broad cobblestoned way proceeds east and west, hugging the inside of the northern wall.  A varied mix of citizens and visitors, including wealthy merchants and their wives, grizzled-looking trappers with freshly-cured pelts slung over their shoulders, and many others who have come to seek their fortunes in Wehnimer's Landing, walk among the ever-vigilant guardsmen.

title: Wehnimer's, North Ring Rd. - 287
description: Worn and uneven paving stones broken by deep ruts cover the road here, making for treacherous footing.  A chorus of sounds emanates from the south and west, as the hum of the bazaar melds with the cries of the traders and hawkers and the singsong of vendors and peddlers.

title: Wehnimer's, North Ring Rd. - 280
description: North Ring Road intersects here with a cobbled street of modest dimensions that opens up to the south, where traffic becomes markedly more dense along the routes to the main square.  Towards the east, the guardtowers at the river gates can be seen in the distance.

title: Wehnimer's, North Ring Rd. - 281
description: The east-west road continues, closed in on the south by the militia barracks and on the north by the twelve-foot-high wall of the city itself.  The insistent thud of leather boots in unison upon cobbled pavement and the clipped shouts of barked orders reverberate off the modwir walls along this part of the road.  The scents of leather, weapon oil and hearty cooking fill the air here.

title: Wehnimer's, North Ring Rd. - 265
description: Here along the main north road, the roughhewn logs of the modwir wood palisade echo passing footsteps on the bumpy cobbled path.  The clammy, briny breeze from the nearby bay fills the air in spite of the sturdy barricade.

title: Wehnimer's, North Ring Rd. - 266
description: A respectful quiet blankets this area like the deep shadow cast by the high north wall.  Those people that move along this section of road walk with their heads bowed and speak in hushed whispers in obvious consideration to the local empath, who practices the restorative arts at the strange tent that is set back from the roadside in the middle of an overgrown vacant lot here.

title: Wehnimer's, North Ring Rd. - 267
description: The perimeter road runs just inside the protective palisades that protect the north wall of the town, affording shelter from the prevailing winds off Darkstone Bay.  The weathered facades of businesses and warehouses line the road leading south into the center of Wehnimer's Landing.  To the east, the road leads to the riverfront, and the town's main gates lie farther to the west.

title: Wehnimer's, North Ring Rd. - 268
description: The west river guardtower looms overhead, marking the end of the road just to the east.  Most of the people passing by here are in uniforms of the various divisions of the town's guards or militia, and even the businesses on the south side of the street seem to cater almost exclusively to military types.

title: Wehnimer's, Bay's Watch West - 249
description: Here at the northern end of Wehnimer's Landing, the fickle waters of the Locksmehr River flow into Darkstone Bay.  The westernmost of the twin guardtowers that keep watch over the river gates into town rises above, casting a shadow over the cobblestones.  The huge ironbound sea gates, greenish water plants clinging to them at water level, straddle the river, extending to the matching tower on the eastern bank.

title: Wehnimer's, Locksmehr Way - 248
description: The faint, tangy scent of the bay mingles with the lighter smells of the river, which runs just to the northeast.  The wide road leads along the riverbank through the warehouse and wharf district, where the sounds of longshoremen loading and unloading freetraders drift over from a wooden walkway to the east.

title: Wehnimer's, Locksmehr Way - 247
description: To the east a dock spears out into the waters of the bay.  Ships from all across the world can be seen tied to the dock, and sailors of many races from many lands pass by.  To one side of the road stands a weathered and grey clapboard warehouse.

title: Wehnimer's, Locksmehr Way - 246
description: The roadway follows the natural bend in the river, which encroaches slightly inland here.  To the west, a lane leads off into the business and warehouse districts of the Landing.  The shrieking of seabirds and the groaning of tall ships straining at anchor echo from the east.

title: Wehnimer's, Locksmehr Way - 251
description: The road snakes and winds to conform to the banks of the river.  In the distance, the low profiles of the shops and warehouses that populate the Landing's western bank can be seen.  To one side of the road, burly workmen load kegs of ale onto a flatbed wagon next to an aging warehouse, while two more wagons stand empty next to the low, cracked curb.  The span of a bridge crosses the river to the southeast.

title: Wehnimer's, West Crossing - 252
description: From here, the vista along the horizon affords a view of both banks of the river.  To the west, the town's low skyline is dominated by rambling structures and a few towers.  To the east lies the bridge across the Locksmehr, carrying a constant flow of people, goods, and wagons.

title: Wehnimer's, Locksmehr Way - 254
description: The massive gate of the Landing's boatyard dominates this stretch of road.  Through it can be seen boats in various states of repair, tied up at wooden docks or beached along the riverbank.  Just offshore lies a coastal sailer half-sunken in the river's shallows, and silhouetted against the horizon just to the northeast is the span of a sturdy bridge.

title: Wehnimer's, Locksmehr Way - 310
description: Dockworkers, sailors, fishermen and tradesmen stream by, coming and going in the course of tending the ships that ferry goods and people between the Landing and the far-flung reaches of Elanthia.  A group of rough-looking sailors lead a captive Ice Krolvin sea captain and his crew through the street, glaring disdainfully at anyone in their path.

title: Wehnimer's, South Ring Rd. - 309
description: South Ring Road leads to the outskirts of Shanty Town, the poorest section of Wehnimer's Landing.  The contrast between the colorful, well-kept buildings of the bazaar and main square and the dingy hovels to the east is striking.  Most passers-by move hurriedly to the west or north to the river crossing.  A ragged child cowers against the south wall, looking lost and forgotten.

title: Wehnimer's, South Ring Rd. - 308
description: Along the edge of the road stands an abandoned shop surrounded by overgrown gardens.  Street urchins play among its remains, their shouts resounding off the modwir wall that borders the east-west road.

title: Wehnimer's, South Ring Rd. - 305
description: Pedestrians and a variety of carts and wagons move along the cobblestoned road in the shadow of the palisades, most focused on going about their business in town.  They pass by the low wood and stone buildings, rarely glancing up or at one another.

title: Wehnimer's, Dragonsclaw Rd. - 306
description: The neatly kept shop on the west side of the street looks like a private residence, except for the displays in its bay window of all the latest fashions.  Elm trees cast an intermittent shade over the cobblestones, and a pair of striped kittens scamper in the dappled light.

title: Wehnimer's, Dragonsclaw Rd. - 307
description: A somber shop by the side of the road attracts a picturesque clientele.  Lissome travellers cloaked in forest green and hunters of many shapes and sizes gather outside.  Some have quivers slung across their backs, others hold menacing-looking contraptions of wood, metal and fiber.  A rugged wooden plaque in the shape of an arrow is nailed to the shop door.

title: Wehnimer's, Dragonsclaw Rd. - 255
description: The road travels roughly parallel to the river's course, skirting the shoreline.  Fishermen, traders, miners, sailors, and townsfolk trek back and forth between the storehouses, shops, docks and offices that constitute the life of Wehnimer's Landing.

title: Wehnimer's, Banker's Square - 241
description: The eastern road leads closer to the river, which can be smelled but not seen from here.  The southern road constricts as it makes a straight cut towards the modwir palisade that surrounds the town, avoiding the maze-like side streets of the riverfront and Shanty Town, which are haunted by dockworkers, warehouse porters, and wharf rats.  A dusty pile of rubble might have been a building once, but whatever it was is unrecognizable now.

title: Wehnimer's, Dragonsclaw Rd. - 242
description: This dingy street is overshadowed by two multi-storied buildings.  At the far end is the unpretentious facade of Beldrin's Gaming Hall, from which the harsh shouts of gamblers, touts, and onlookers echo into the street.  Across the way is a local inn, frequented by sailors, dockworkers and fishermen, from the looks of the clientele gathered around the doorway.

title: Wehnimer's, Dragonsclaw Rd. - 243
description: Wagons and carts loaded with a variety of goods pass in all directions, from the center of the busy town to the west to the wharfs and piers along the Locksmehr River to the east.  A number of militiamen head north towards the guardtowers and barracks.

title: Wehnimer's, Dragonsclaw Rd. - 244
description: The large, deserted-looking shed to the east looks as if it once served as a stable or a workshop of some sort.  Now it seems to be nothing more than a crumbling warehouse, and the sparse traffic flowing to the north and south seldom gives it a second look.

title: Wehnimer's, Atropa St. - 245
description: Here Atropa Street meets Dragonsclaw Road, which traverses the Landing to the south, and combines with Taarna Road to the west.  A gentle rise in the ground affords a glimpse of the hills and open countryside that lie beyond the town walls far to the south.

title: Wehnimer's, Taarna Rd. - 322
description: Traffic flows past briskly, headed north towards the palisade along the bay, south to the market and shops of the Landing, and east to the riverfront.  A decrepit single-story pawnshop, its paint peeling and window panes broken, stands here alongside the busy lane.

title: Wehnimer's, Taarna Rd. - 269
description: The street here leads north and south, its nearness to the north wall and the docks made obvious by the smell of salt water and fish coming in on the breeze off the bay.  A few flowering weeds thrive in patches of dirt between the cobblestones on less-traveled parts of the road.

title: Wehnimer's, Taarna Rd. - 321
description: A small house is set back from the curve in the road, in the midst of a carefully tended garden of strange plants.  A twisting path leading to the door is lined with carved wooden pots in which grow many species of pungent herbs.  Two modwir saplings entwine over the door, forming a leafy arch.

title: Wehnimer's, Stormarm St. - 272
description: A few warehouses, small shops and businesses, and unmarked buildings with weathered modwir siding predominate along this part of the road.  The street is less crowded than those near the docks or the square, and the irregular cobblestones are slick and unyielding underfoot.

title: Wehnimer's, Stormarm St. - 320
description: Along this neighborhood byway, wagons loaded with sacks of grain, kegs of beer, and firewood stand at the wide door of a local warehouse.  Merchants, innkeepers and tradesmen of the surrounding streets busily load and unload stored supplies here.

title: Wehnimer's, Lanthar Rd. - 323
description: Lanthar Road leads east and west here, serving as a passage between the local inns and warehouses bordering the riverfront district and the center of Wehnimer's Landing.  A stray jarlik sniffs at a patch of grass growing between cracks in the cobbled pavement to one side of the road.

title: Wehnimer's, Beolost Rd. - 317
description: Townswomen and loiterers cluster around a local well, which is constructed of stone with a slate overhang that provides a spot of shade and rest.  The oft-swept, cobbled square also contains the baker's shop and its adjoining tea room, and several other small merchants.

title: Wehnimer's, Beolost Rd. - 257
description: Two peaceful lanes meet here.  The houses lining the street look cheerful and the aroma of simmering stews and roasting meat fills the air.  A mother calls to her child from the second-floor window of a prim house, cajoling him to leave his friends and come inside.

title: Wehnimer's, Wisraith Lane - 238
description: The laughter of children at play echoes along this pleasant, cobbled street, where clumps of decorative bushes by the roadside add splashes of green to the mostly brown and grey townscape.  A small boy, obviously the quarry in a game of tag, darts by in an attempt to escape from his pursuers.

title: Wehnimer's, Wisraith Lane - 237
description: Interspersed among the small businesses and shops along the cobbled road are a few modwir-shingled private houses.  They are gaily decorated, competing for individuality with one another by means of daubs of colorful paint, skillfully carved doors and shutters, and window boxes bursting with ornamental flowers and fresh herbs.  A bright yellow awning marks the entrance to the florist, whose windows are brimming with fresh blossoms.

title: Wehnimer's, Erebor Square - 235
description: This quiet corner resembles a calm island amid the bustling life of Wehnimer's Landing.  At the west end, a low, broad dome is visible.  In the center of the square, several benches of polished wood and smooth stone surround a sculpture that stands as a sentinel before the Wehnimer's Museum.  Cast in bronze, the work imparts a sense of peace, calm and protection to the landscaped surroundings.  A gold plaque mounted on a gracefully chiseled malachite base stands before it.

title: Wehnimer's, Erebor Square - 236
description: Ancient grey flagstones pave this quiet corner of the square, set around small gardens of herbs and flowers that provide splashes of color in the filtered light.   Polished wood benches arranged under the branches of a variety of shade trees offer a place for scholars and travelers to study and rest.

title: Wehnimer's, Riverwind St. - 239
description: Here Riverwind Street meets Lyon Way at an angle.  The structures by the roadside are oddly shaped to match the turning of the way.

title: Wehnimer's, Lyon Way - 275
description: Here Lyon Way runs southeast into Riverwind Street, serving as a conduit for passage between the river and the bazaar and shops.  Most of the more reputable-looking citizens seem to be steering clear of a dimly lit cul-de-sac which lies due south of the intersection.

title: Wehnimer's, Stormarm St. - 319
description: The simple yet well built wooden structures in this small residential section of town are more functional than decorative, and little separates the style of one from another.  A few scraggly trees, planted long ago in patches of dirt between the buildings, add spots of shade to the cobblestones.

title: Wehnimer's, Stormarm St. - 271
description: This intersection links the bazaar routes with those bisecting and encircling the Landing.  A few ruddyfaced sailors, loudmouthed dockworkers, and off-duty soldiers linger along the wall of a tavern, which is set back from the side of the road up a slight incline.  A shaky wooden stairway, the bane of many an overimbiber's existence, leads up to the tavern door.

title: Wehnimer's, Stormarm St. - 270
description: This street cuts a wide path north and south between the north wall and the center of the Landing.  Low, grey stone buildings and nondescript sheds loom to the south and east, and towards the central square the view is more pleasant and varied.

title: Wehnimer's, Dagmar Lane - 264
description: This long, narrow dirt road presses between several buildings, connecting one of the quieter corners of this part of town with the main thoroughfares, where small residences and humble shops give way to the larger emporia, offices and grander structures.  A heavy iron-banded door has been set into a high wall of the town barracks.

title: Wehnimer's, Valeria St. - 263
description: Flatbed wagons carrying loads of wood or other goods lumber slowly to the east and west, bouncing over a large pothole in the road.  A nondescript building, with a prominent sign in the shape of a key above its black door, is set back slightly from the street.

title: Wehnimer's, Valeria St. - 262
description: The footsteps of passing wayfarers and townspeople echo on the cobbled pavement between the rows of two-story wooden houses that flank the lane.  The street seems a bit less congested here, blocks away from the busy square to the west.

title: Wehnimer's, Mikhail St. - 261
description: Loud clanging noises come from the yard to one side of the road.  The yard is enclosed by a tall iron gate, welded to which is a peculiar sign in the shape of a horseshoe with crossed hammer and tongs upon it.  Along the side of the street, dumped unceremoniously by the gate, is a heap of coal and a pile of dark-colored rocks.

title: Wehnimer's, Lyon Way - 260
description: The intermittent rhythm of movement through the street to the east and west is accentuated by a constant loud clanging coming from the north, where a column of smoke rises from a towering chimney.  A flatbed wagon has been abandoned here where it collided with the wall of a shabby workshop, and now serves only as amusement for the local children who play on its ruined platform.

title: Wehnimer's, Lyon Way - 273
description: The two- and three-story homes of some of the Landing's middle-class citizens are situated at this bend in Lyon Way.  Whitewash has been applied to most of the wooden structures, though soot from somewhere nearby stains many of their painted surfaces, and window boxes full of flowers add splashes of color here and there.

title: Wehnimer's, Cul-de-Sac - 324
description: Broken bottles, discarded rubbish, and uneasy feelings pervade this dank, ill-lit dead end.  Several unsavory-looking citizens seem to be lurking here and there in the shadows for want of anything better to do, and the scratching of rats can be heard from within the nearby walls.  A pile of old crates is stacked against the back wall of the alley.

title: Wehnimer's, Erebor Square - 234
description: The dome of a large temple rises above this peaceful square.  The circular building is surrounded by marble porticos and teak columns, and a promenade leads to two pillars, through which the inner sanctum can be glimpsed.  Priests, acolytes, monks and worshippers move here and there, engaged in various rituals of devotion or study.  A locked almsbox is securely bolted to an iron pole alongside the pillars.

title: Wehnimer's, Airioch Lane - 258
description: Bordering the temple perimeter, this lane contains a few cheery cottages and friendly shops.  It offers refreshing change from the older, rutted streets and noisy stores of the bazaar and the town square.

title: Wehnimer's, Airioch Lane - 302
description: This tree-dotted lane passes through a residential pocket of the Landing.  The cobbled dirt road leads past well-kept single or two-floor houses, built of wood and stone with carved shutters and doors that can be closed against inclement weather or dangerous invasions.

title: Wehnimer's, Cheridin Ave. - 233
description: Several small shops crowd along the street, which is composed of the back walls of the high buildings bordering the central square.  Each storefront vies with the others for street space and the attention of the many travellers who pass through here.  Other traders, hoping to take advantage of the traffic attracted by the nearby temple, have set up stands and pushcarts spilling over with clothing, trinkets and souvenirs gathered during their travels far and wide.

title: Wehnimer's, Cheridin Ave. - 232
description: On the west side of this narrow stretch of Cheridin Avenue is the wooden back of the Moot Hall, and the dour building that houses the local constabulary and its jail looms along the other side of the street.  To the southeast, a stone dome rises over the compound that surrounds the Landing's largest temple.  The traffic here flows quickly north and south without much pause.

title: Wehnimer's, Cheridin Ave. - 231
description: The intersection of the broad avenue with the narrower byway connecting to the bazaar to the west creates a fleeting bottleneck in the foot traffic.  Older wood and stone buildings, mostly small shops and offices with upstairs lodgings overlooking the street, predominate here.

title: Wehnimer's, Cheridin Ave. - 259
description: Many of the dwellings that line this section of road have shutters closed or curtains drawn to keep out the noise and dust raised by the constant flow of traffic along the street.  Just south of here, the traffic on Cheridin streams west towards the bazaar.  To the east, the lanes twist through neighborhoods composed of serviceable shops and modest residences.

title: Wehnimer's, The Mews - 278
description: The large, barn-like structure that dominates the north side of the block is the city stable.  Through a ground-floor window can be seen the rows of now-empty stalls in the dark interior.  The pavement just outside is strewn with straw and debris that merits a careful step along this part of the road.  To the west is the main square and its cobblestoned bazaar, where furious trading takes place on a daily basis.

title: Wehnimer's, The Mews - 279
description: This narrow lane runs north to south, shaded by the narrow, unadorned buildings that loom on both sides of the rough paving stones.  The clatter of wagon wheels on cobbled streets and the jangling of iron-fitted harnesses echoes from the south, along with a scent of leather and livestock.

title: Wehnimer's, Land's End Rd. - 223
description: Vigilant guardsmen scrutinize the citizens and travelers arriving and departing through the wide gates spanning the land route into Wehnimer's Landing.  The frenetic pace of the city to the south is a far cry from the deceptive calm of the wilds of Elanith outside.  Two daunting towers survey the countryside and protect the town, flanking the road to the east and west.

title: Wehnimer's, Talon St. - 226
description: The street runs between the northern palisade and the central square to the south and east.  The traffic is varied here, as shoppers, traders, travelers and merchants mix with the ever-present and watchful militiamen.  The pristine walls of the Stone Baths occupy nearly the entire block.

title: Wehnimer's, Valeria St. - 277
description: Traffic to and from the hub of activity in the square to the west clogs the street here.  Passers-by guard their valuables closely, glancing into doorways and niches and wary of the press of the crowd.  Two-story buildings of wood and stone line the north and south sides of the cobbled road.

title: Town Square, Northeast - 276
description: The entrance to Tykel's Arms, its heavy door bounded by iron-barred windows, dominates this corner of the square.  All manner of citizens pass by, moving among the solid, multistoried wooden buildings that surround the bazaar.  Just to the southwest can be seen the tree-shaded heart of the square, where citizens and adventurers gather for socializing, healing and rest.

title: Town Square, Northwest - 227
description: This corner of the square is lively and hectic.  A number of representatives of the Landing's population, including several elven loggers and a party of rough-looking dwarves, loiter around the door of the Raging Thrak Inn, where the rowdy cheers of patrons and voices raised in songs of many sorts, from snatches of heroic ballads to blushingly bawdy tunes, beckon you to enter.

title: Town Square Central - 228
description: This is the heart of the main square of Wehnimer's Landing.  The impromptu shops of the bazaar are clustered around this central gathering place, where townsfolk, travellers, and adventurers meet to talk, conspire or raise expeditions to the far-flung reaches of Elanith.  At the north end of the space, an old well, with moss-covered stones and a craggy roof, is shaded by a strong, robust tree.  The oak is tall and straight, and it is apparent that the roots run deep.

title: Town Square, East - 229
description: Here in the center of a broad plaza near the commercial area of the bazaar stands the impressive facade of the slate-roofed Moot Hall, where the citizens of Wehnimer's Landing hold various official, religious and social functions.  Facing the square are some of the town's more prosperous and bustling shops.

title: Wehnimer's, Penna St. - 230
description: The constant din of the merchants, tradesmen and hawkers in the shops to the west is muted here.  The cracked pavement, scattered cobblestones, and dirt drainage ditches along the side of the road form a not-so-gradual transition between the bustling avenues of the main bazaar and the less frequented, humbler, and more unsavory sections of the town.

title: Wehnimer's, South Ring Rd. - 303
description: The ongoing parade of citizenry that passes by seems to take on a special character in this part of town.  Mixed in with the usual denizens, you notice a preponderance of travellers who appear to be pilgrims, priests and monks.  They file in and out of the road to the north.

title: Wehnimer's, South Ring Rd. - 301
description: A small but constant group of local residents gathers around the small well next to the palisade.  They chat idly as the traffic from the connecting road disperses to the east and west, and others with business in the heart of town head north.

title: Wehnimer's, South Ring Rd. - 300
description: The green and rolling countryside outside the town can be glimpsed through a crack in the south palisade wall.  A cool and refreshing mountain breeze whistles between the logs, freshening the air with a brisk scent of pine.

title: Wehnimer's, South Ring Rd. - 299
description: A spacious boulevard intersects the Ring Road at this point.  Numerous traders and peddlers cart their wares north to sell at the main bazaar, while townsfolk scatter east and west bearing packages, sacks and purchases.

title: Wehnimer's, South Ring Rd. - 298
description: A short distance to the east lies a broad intersection.  To the west, the road narrows slightly as it is impinged on by closely-spaced shops, beyond which the western and southern city walls intersect.  Prosperous ladies and well-to-do gentlemen mingle in the street with the more common folk of the town.

title: Wehnimer's, South Ring Rd. - 296
description: The clamor of the traffic is punctuated by the sound of metal bouncing against metal.  A group of children play in the shadow of the buildings, pitching coppers against the wall of a shop.  From one small storefront comes the sound of a lilting melody being picked out on a lute.

title: Town Square, South Alley - 297
description: This narrow alleyway passes crookedly between the old wood and stone walls of the surrounding buildings, providing a shaded byway from the busy road to the south to a small park nestled in a grassy niche to the north.  An occasional stray mutt sniffs around the foundations, searching for rats or morsels.

title: Town Square, Small Park - 288
description: A small, shady park fills an old vacant lot behind a row of buildings, the bustling sounds of the square filtering through the passage to the north to animate the area despite its appearance of peace and serenity.  A weatherworn grey marble statue of a stocky human in pioneer's clothing overlooks the park, his stone hat encrusted by the gifts of decades of passing birds and his right hand half-upraised as if it once held some now-missing object.

title: Town Square, Southwest - 284
description: This corner of the square seems somewhat subdued.  Townsfolk pass through on their way to the shops, the bazaar, or the main well at the center of the square.  Others hurry past, anxious to get home or go on about their business.

title: Town Square, Southeast - 282
description: Foot and wagon traffic swarms off in all directions here, some going to the large intersection with South Ring Road, others crisscrossing the square via the bazaar.  Men and women carrying neatly tied parcels or sacks and coils of rope slung over their arms emerge from the wooden facade of the old general store.

title: Wehnimer's, Parsnips St. - 283
description: This broad conduit leading between the south wall and the square hums with the activities of those passing through.  To one side stands a sedate and dignified shop, the scroll-like sign over its door inscribed in a striking and elegant manner.

title: Wehnimer's, West Ring Rd. - 290
description: The road bends to conform to the inside curve of the southern and western walls of the high modwir log palisades, which converge here.  A whiff of the scents of the marketplace rises from a narrow lane to the east.

title: Wehnimer's, West Ring Rd. - 291
description: Traffic is light on this portion of West Ring Road.  Most people seem to be using the busier roads that lie to the north and south, leading to the square.  A few warehouses and smaller shops line the way here.
